author: draganrakita
content:
While tried to sync on yolo3x i noticed that OE disconnects Geth, it seems that geth naming `snap`protocol is inconsistent with devp2p specification, and reason for disconnection.
Unfortunately, until this is fixed we are unable to participate in yolo3x testnet.
Here is spec I am referring from old wiki that says that protocol name must be length-3 ascii: https://github.com/ethereum/wiki/blob/old-before-deleting-all-files-go-to-wiki-wiki-instead/%C3%90%CE%9EVp2p-Wire-Protocol.md#p2p

author: _shemnon
content: This one?  https://github.com/ethereum/devp2p/blob/master/caps/snap.md - date is Nov 2020, at most 4 months.  Also, prior capabilities and RLPx changes (eth/64, eth/65, ENR) all had associated EIPs and at least the eth/* changes were discussed on ACD.  So it's a stretch to say it was accepted.

author: _shemnon
content: Good idea and valuable, but it needs to go through the same process other changes did.

author: _shemnon
content: This opens the question of what is needed for non-consensus changes.  I think one important step is multiple client implementations as that proves (a) interoperability and (b) community acceptance.

author: _shemnon
content: On a related note, Besu just shipped support for EIP-778 and EIP-868, so we can check that item off on those two EIPs.  It would be nice if other clients implemented those so the `all.*.ethdisco.net` entries don't just contain Geth and Besu nodes.
